Identification.ShortTitle: Goods for Ships and Aircraft (Excise) Drawback Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Drawback of Taxes Paid on Goods Manufactured or Produced in Canada that are Supplied as Ships’ Stores, Used for the Equipment, Repair or Reconstruction of Ships or Aircraft or Delivered to Telegraph Cable Ships Proceeding on an Ocean Voyage for Use in Laying or Repairing Oceanic Telegraph Cables Outside Canadian Territorial Waters

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of National Revenue, pursuant to subsection 46(1)* of the Excise Tax Act, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations respecting the drawback of taxes paid on goods manufactured or produced in Canada that are supplied as ships’ stores, used for the equipment, repair or reconstruction of ships or aircraft or delivered to telegraph cable ships proceeding on an ocean voyage for use in laying or repairing oceanic telegraph cables outside Canadian territorial waters, effective on the day the Customs Act**, other than paragraph 99(1)(b), subsections 99(2) to (4) and sections 192 to 194 thereof, comes into force.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Goods for Ships and Aircraft (Excise) Drawback Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Excise Tax Act; (Loi)
ships’ stores means goods that have been designated as ships stores by the Ships’ Stores Regulations. (approvisionnements de navire)

Section.Text: These Regulations apply to the grant, under subsection 46(1) of the Act and in the circumstances and under the conditions prescribed in section 6, of a drawback of taxes paid on goods manufactured or produced in Canada that are

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: used for the equipment, repair or reconstruction of ships or aircraft set out in the schedule; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: delivered to any telegraph cable ship proceeding on an ocean voyage for use in laying or repairing oceanic telegraph cables outside Canadian territorial waters.

Section.Text: A drawback may only be claimed by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person who supplied the goods referred to in paragraphs 3(a) and (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person who used the goods for the equipment, repair or reconstruction of ships or aircraft referred to in paragraph 3(b).

Section.Text: An application for a drawback must be filed in the prescribed form at the excise office nearest the head office or a branch office of the claimant within four years after the taxes were paid.
A drawback may only be granted if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the goods referred to in section 3 were supplied, used or delivered as described in paragraph 3(a), (b) or (c), as the case may be, before an application for the drawback is filed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the goods referred to in section 3 were not used in Canada for any purpose before being supplied, used or delivered as described in paragraph 3(a), (b) or (c), as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of goods used for the equipment, repair or reconstruction of a ship or aircraft referred to in paragraph 3(b), the goods become part of the ship or aircraft or part of the equipment of that ship or aircraft referred to in that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of goods delivered to a telegraph cable ship proceeding on an ocean voyage for use in laying or repairing oceanic telegraph cables outside Canadian territorial waters, the ship is registered and is used exclusively for laying or repairing oceanic telegraph cables; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant provides a waiver, in the prescribed form, from all other persons entitled to claim a drawback, refund or remission of the taxes, waiving their right to do so.

Section.Text: Ocean-going ships operating or being repaired or reconstructed to operate exclusively in international trade
Foreign warships, within the meaning of the Ships Stores Regulations
Telegraph cable ships, within the meaning of the Ships Stores Regulations
Aircraft operating exclusively in international flights
Ships registered in a country other than Canada that are used exclusively for pleasure purposes
International aircraft, within the meaning of the Ships Stores Regulations
